params.locator: How to find the element to be clicked.

clickElement.description: Click an element on the current page.

params.locator: How to find the element to be clicked.

doubleClickElement.description: Click an element on the current page twice.

mouseOverElement.description: Move the mouse cursor over the given element.

params.locator: How to find the element to type into.
params.text: The text to set its content to.

setElementText.description: Set the text content of the given element.

params.locator: How to find the element to type into.

sendKeysToElement.description: Type text into an element on the current page.

params.locator: How to find the element to select.

setElementSelected.description: Select an element. If it's a check box or radio button, it will become ticked. If it's an option inside a <select>, that option will become the chosen one. If it's an option inside a multi-select, that option will be added to the selection.

params.locator: How to find the element to de-select.

setElementNotSelected.description: Un-select an element. If it's a check box, it will become not ticked. If it's an option inside a multi-select, that option will be removed from the selection.

params.locator: How to find the select element to clear.

clearSelections.description: Clears the selections in a multi-select element.

params.locator: How to find the element whose form to submit.

submitElement.description: Submits the form the targeted element is a part of. The element does not have to be the submit button - it can be any field or the form itself.

params.locator: How to find the element to drag and drop.
params.targetLocator: The element to drop the first one into

dragToAndDropElement.description: Drags and drops an element onto another element.

params.locator: How to find the element to click on.

clickAndHoldElement.description: Starts clicking on an element but does not release the virtual mouse button.

params.locator: How to find the element to stop clicking on.

releaseElement.description: Stops holding down the virtual mouse button.

params.name: The cookie's name.
params.options: Cookie options. Format is path=[path],max_age=[max age in milliseconds]. Either or both options can be left out.

addCookie.description: Creates a cookie for the current domain.

params.name: The name of the cookie to be deleted.

deleteCookie.description: Deletes the cookie of the given name for the current domain.

params.file: The path to save the screenshot to.

saveScreenshot.description: Saves a screenshot of the current page, as a PNG image.

params.waitTime: The time to pause, in ms.

pause.description: Pauses script execution for a given amount of time.

params.identifier: The name or ID of the frame to switch to. Note that Selenium 1 style relative=X parameters are not supported.

switchToFrame.description: Switches playback to a different frame.

params.name: The name of the window to switch to. Note that Selenium 1 style relative=X parameters are not supported.

switchToWindow.description: Switches playback to a different window.

switchToDefaultContent.description: Switches playback to the default/top frame.

params.text: The text to type into the prompt.

answerAlert.description: Type the given text into the alert prompt.

params.url: The URL we want to be at.

assertCurrentUrl.description: Asserts that the current URL is the given value. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.title: Title we want the current page to have.

assertTitle.description: Asserts that the current page has the given title. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.locator: How to find the element whose text to test.
params.text: The text we want the element to have.

assertText.description: Asserts that the given element contains exactly the given text. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.text: The text we want to feature on the page.

assertTextPresent.description: Asserts that the given text is somewhere on the page. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.text: The text we want the entire page to be.

assertBodyText.description: Asserts that the text of the entire page body is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

assertPageSource.description: Asserts that the current page's source is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

assertElementPresent.description: Asserts that the given element exists. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

assertElementSelected.description: Asserts that the given element is selected. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.attributeName: The name of the attribute to check.
params.value: The value we want the attribute to have.

assertElementAttribute.description: Asserts that an element's attribute has a specific value. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.propertyName: The name of the CSS style property to check.
params.value: The value we want the property to have.

assertElementStyle.description: Asserts that an element's CSS style property has a specific value. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.value: The value we want the element to have.

assertElementValue.description: Asserts that an element's value is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

assertCookiePresent.description: Asserts that a cookie with the given name is present. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

params.name: The cookie's name.
params.value: The value (content) the cookie is expected to have.

assertCookieByName.description: Asserts that a cookie with the given name is present. If this is not the case, script execution will stop and be marked as failed.

assertAlertText.description: Asserts that there is an alert showing with the given text.

assertAlertPresent.description: Asserts that there is an alert showing.

params.script: A JavaScript expression to be evaluated.
params.value: The value the script is expected to evaluate to.

assertEval.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression within the context of the page and asserts it matches the given value. Use 'return' to return the result of the evaluation, e.g. 'return 3'.

params.url: The URL we want to be at.

verifyCurrentUrl.description: Verifies that the current URL is the given value. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.title: Title we want the current page to have.

verifyTitle.description: Verifies that the current page has the given title. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.locator: How to find the element whose text to test.
params.text: The text we want the element to have.

verifyText.description: Verifies that the given element contains exactly the given text. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.text: The text we want to feature on the page.

verifyTextPresent.description: Verifies that the given text is somewhere on the page. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.text: The text we want the entire page to be.

verifyBodyText.description: Verifies that the text of the entire page body is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

verifyPageSource.description: Verifies that the current page's source is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

verifyElementPresent.description: Verifies that the given element exists. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

verifyElementSelected.description: Verifies that the given element is selected. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.attributeName: The name of the attribute to check.
params.value: The value we want the attribute to have.

verifyElementAttribute.description: Verifies that an element's attribute has a specific value. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.propertyName: The name of the CSS style property to check.
params.value: The value we want the property to have.

verifyElementStyle.description: Verifies that an element's CSS style property has a specific value. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.value: The value we want the element to have.

verifyElementValue.description: Verifies that an element's value is as given. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

verifyCookiePresent.description: Verifies that a cookie with the given name is present. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.name: The cookie's name.
params.value: The value (content) the cookie is expected to have.

verifyCookieByName.description: Verifies that a cookie with the given name is present. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

verifyAlertText.description: Verifies that there is an alert showing with the given text.

verifyAlertPresent.description: Verifies that there is an alert showing.

params.script: A JavaScript expression to be evaluated.
params.value: The value the script is expected to evaluate to.

verifyEval.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression within the context of the page and verifies it matches the given value. Use 'return' to return the result of the evaluation, e.g. 'return 3'. If this is not the case, script execution will be marked as failed, but the script will continue running.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the text in.
params.text: The text to store in the variable.

store.description: Stores the given text in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the URL in.

storeCurrentUrl.description: Stores the current URL in the given variable.

params.variable: Name of the variable to store the title into.

storeTitle.description: Stores the title of the current page in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the element's text in.
params.locator: How to find the element whose text to store.

storeText.description: Stores an element's text content in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store whether the given text is on the page.

storeTextPresent.description: Stores whether the given text is anywhere on the page in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the page body text in.

storeBodyText.description: Stores the page body text in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the page source in.

storePageSource.description: Stores the page source in the given variable.

params.variable: Name of the variable to store the attribute value in.

storeElementSelected.description: Stores whether the element is selected in the given variable.

params.variable: Name of the variable to store the attribute value in.
params.attributeName: The name of the attribute to store.

storeElementAttribute.description: Stores an element's attribute in the given variable.

params.variable: Name of the variable to store the property value in.
params.propertyName: The name of the CSS style property to store.

storeElementStyle.description: Stores an element's CSS style property in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the element's value in.

storeElementValue.description: Stores an element's value in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable where to store whether the cookie exists.
params.name: The cookie name.

storeCookiePresent.description: Stores whether a cookie with the given name exists.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the cookie's value in.
params.name: The cookie's name.

storeCookieByName.description: Stores the value (content) of the cookie with the given name in a variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store the text in.

storeAlertText.description: Store the text of the visible alert in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store in whether an alert is present.

storeAlertPresent.description: Store whether an alert is present in the given variable.

params.variable: The name of the variable to store evaluation result in.
params.script: A JavaScript expression to be evaluated. Use 'return' to return the result of the evaluation, e.g. 'return 3'.

storeEval.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression and stores the result in a variable.
